content.question:
Figure 1 represents the relative time and sequence of the phases of the cell cycle.

Figure 1. Representation of the cell cycle and identification of the <math alttext="G 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>/<math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></math> checkpoint

Which statement best predicts why a cellâ€™s progression through the cell cycle might be halted at the <math alttext="G 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>/<math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> checkpoint?

choices.label: Spindle fibers have not correctly attached to chromosomes.
There are not enough nucleotides available to construct new <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Damage occurred to <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> when it was being copied in <math alttext="G 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Proteins necessary for <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> phase of the cell cycle have not been produced.

content.answer: There are not enough nucleotides available to construct new <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
